com.ibm.zrl.idmx.issuance
Class Recipient

java.lang.Object
  com.ibm.zrl.idmx.issuance.Recipient

public class Recipient
extends java.lang.Object

The credential recipient (or user) for the CL credential issuance.

See Also:
Issuer

Constructor Detail

Recipient

public Recipient(IssuanceSpec issuanceSpec,
                 java.math.BigInteger pseudonym,
                 java.lang.String pseudonymName,
                 java.lang.String theDomNymName,
                 MasterSecret masterSecret,
                 Values theValues)
Constructor to create the Recipient protocol end point, who will receive the credential.

Parameters:
issuanceSpec - Issuance specification.
pseudonym - (optional) A pseudonym.
pseudonymName - (optional) A pseudonym name. The recipient's master secret.
theDomNymName - (optional) The name of a domain pseudonym.
masterSecret - Master secret to be used.
theValues - Values of the attributes that will be contained in the credential to be issued.

Recipient

public Recipient(IssuanceSpec issuanceSpec,
                 MasterSecret masterSecret,
                 Values theValues)
Constructor to create the Recipient protocol end point, who will receive the credential.

Parameters:
issuanceSpec - Issuance specification.
masterSecret - The recipient's master secret.
theValues - Values of the attributes that will be contained in the credential to be issued.
Method Detail

round1

public final Message round1(java.math.BigInteger theNonce1)
Parameters:
theNonce1 - Nonce provided by the verifier.
Returns:
Message containing the proof about the hidden and committed attributes sent to the Issuer.

round3

public final Credential round3(Message msg)
Called with the second protocol flow as input, outputs the Credential. This is the last step of the issuance protocol, where the Recipient verifies that the signature is valid and outputs it.

Parameters:
msg - the second flow of the protocol, a message from the Issuer
Returns:
the Credential, if it's valid, null otherwise.
